column1: Galich (Russian: Галич) is a town in Kostroma Oblast
column3: located on the southern bank of Lake Galichskoye. As of the 2010 Census

column1: == History ==
It was first chronicled in 1234 as Grad Mersky (lit. the town of the Merya). It gradually developed into one of the greatest salt-mining centers of Eastern Europe
column2: eclipsing the southern town of Halych
column3: from which it takes its name. In the 13th century
column4: Galich was ruled by a younger brother of Alexander Nevsky and remained in his line until 1363
column5: when the Muscovites seized the principality and ousted the ruling family to Novgorod.

column1: The 15th and 16th centuries are justly considered the golden age of Galich. At that time it controlled most of the Russian trade in salt and furs. Dmitry Shemyaka and other local princes pressed their claims to the Muscovite crown
column2: and three of them actually took possession of the Kremlin in the course of the Great Feudal War.

column1: The early medieval earthen ramparts were further fortified in the early 15th and 16th centuries and have since been known as Shemyaka Hills. The Poles burnt it to the ground in 1612
column2: Peter the Great had a wooden kremlin demolished
column3: and it further declined with the transfer of Russian foreign trade from Arkhangelsk to St. Petersburg.

column1: Town status was granted to Galich in 1778.
== Administrative and municipal status ==
Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Galich serves as the administrative center of Galichsky District
column3: even though it is not a part of it. As an administrative division
column4: it is incorporated separately as the town of oblast significance of Galich—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column5: the town of oblast significance of Galich is incorporated as Galich Urban Okrug.

column1: == Economy ==
The Galich Mobile Crane Plant (Russian: ОАО "Галичский автокрановый завод") manufactures some 20% of Russia's entire mobile crane production.
Town's industries also manufacture steel barrels
column3: and clothing. There is a timber mill in town as well.

column1: The town is also a minor railroad node of the Trans-Siberian Railway.

column1: == Culture ==
Historic monuments of Galich include various buildings from the imperial period of Russian history. Particularly noteworthy is the Paisiev Monastery
column2: founded in the early 14th century and featuring a 16th-century five-domed cathedral and a three-domed church from 1642.
